item.title: Topological Space
item.description: Let $X$ be a set. We would like to formalize We thus make the following Definition. Let $X$ be a set. A topology on $X$ is a family $\mc{T}\subseteq\pow(X)$, whose elements are called open sets, subject to the following conditions. (Non-trivial). $\em$ and $X$ are in $\mc{T}$. (Closure under $\cup$). For any $\mc{U}\subseteq\mc{T}$, we have $\bigcup\mc{U}\in\mc{T}$. (Closure under finite $\cap$). For any $U_1,U_2\in\mc{T}$, we have $U_1\cap U_2\in\mc{T}$. If $\mc{T}$ is a topology on $X$, we call the pair $\tpl{X,\mc{T}}$ a topological space.
